column: What did we get wrong or forget? In the next two weeks, what will you do differently, what exactly will you check or count, and how will you decide what to stop and what to keep doing?
In the next 30 days, what ideas do you want to test? What signs or proof would make you change your mind? What current activities will you stop or reduce so that you have time and energy to learn?
How will you treat these rumours as useful information, not just noise? Where and how will you listen, how will you collect this feedback, and how will it shape your next version of SokoLink?

In one market cycle, how will you sit with them, watch, and listen to understand their experience? How will you test changes together with them (not just design for them) and then adjust SokoLink based on what you learn?

When you compare USSD with offline use and a small printer to a telco-only smartphone app, what does each option mean for who can use it, how well it works when the network fails, how costly it is for users, and how well it protects data, and which option do you choose for the next test and why?

How would you design a consent process for people who cannot read well, for example using a short Lusoga audio message and a clear way to say â€œno,â€ that still works offline and leaves a record that can be checked later when the data syncs?

If the network goes down again, what are the exact steps you will follow to record each transaction while offline, give the user proof, and then sync the data and update receipts when the network comes back?
If you find a small mistake in how data was recorded, who will you inform, what will you share publicly, and what will you change so that this kind of mistake does not happen again?

How would you design a test in two markets that compares Prototype A and Prototype B, including limits on volume, clear success targets, and rules for when to stop or continue, and what kind of surprising result would make you change your plan and how?
What is one low-cost idea that can improve inclusion without buying new equipment, and how will you test this idea in one week?
How will you work together with market mamas and buyers so that they help design the next version of SokoLink, and what exactly will you do in the session and produce at the end?
After the sprint, how will you write a short public message saying, â€œwe heard you, we changed,â€ and which three changes will you highlight and why?

When you look at the main actors (district leaders, MTN, brokers, church leaders, buyers, police) during election season, what does each one want, what are three things you will not cross (red lines), and how will you make sure these are clearly written into the MoU?
If a market leader hints that they want a â€œfacilitation,â€ what steps will you take to say no, record what happened, and still protect the relationship and the program?
The district wants SokoLink to link with their market fee system. What rules and safeguards will you propose so this link does not silence womenâ€™s voices, and clear limits on how data is shared?

You are planning a radio talk show to rebuild trust. Who will speak on the show, what three key messages will they repeat, and how will you check if trust is growing in ways that go beyond just likes or call-ins?
